definition: to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
(idiom) nurture makes second nature/good habits come by long assimilation

sentences.english: Nobody supervised our reading. We were on our own.
sentences.chinese: 读书看报，无人监督，纯属自愿，自我熏陶。

sentences.english: His success can't be separated from the nurture and edification of Yimeng Culture.
sentences.chinese: 诸葛亮的成才离不开沂蒙文化对他的哺育与熏陶。

sentences.english: In this kind of temperament, I passed the edification of one another.
sentences.chinese: 在这种气质的熏陶中，我走过一个又一个春秋。

sentences.english: To learn ancient prose is to accept the influence and teaching of traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 学习古诗文就是在接受传统文化的熏陶与教化。

sentences.english: Because his home schooled, Li Shizhen enjoyed medicine from childhood.
sentences.chinese: 由于家庭的熏陶，李时珍从小就喜爱医药。

definition: to exert a gradual influence/to nurture/a corrupting influence
to teach by words and example (idiom)
lit. to fire pots and smelt metal/fig. to educate
variant of 啟蒙|启蒙[qi3 meng2]/to instruct the young
to instruct the young/to initiate/to awake sb from ignorance/to free sb from prejudice or superstition/primer/enlightened/the Enlightenment/Western learning from the late Qing dynasty
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
family with a literary reputation (idiom); literary family
deposits accumulated over long periods/fig. valuable experience, accumulated wisdom
